name: 2 Tone
description: Combines 1960s Jamaican Ska with Punk Rock and New Wave to create tracks played at faster tempos and with a harder edge than the original Jamaican records.

name: Jamaican Ska
description: Originated in Jamaica with groups who combined Jazz and Rhythm & Blues with rhythms of traditional Caribbean Music like Mento and Calypso.

name: Spouge
description: Fusion of Calypso and Ska originating in Barbados during the 1960s and 70s.

name: Third Wave Ska
description: Expanded on the 2 Tone period, adding further Rock elements resulting in a heavier sound.

children.name: Ska Punk
children.description: Characterized by up-tempo skank rhythms, catchy horn sections, and spirited guitar work; delivered with a fun and rebellious energy.

children.name: Skacore
children.description: Fuses skank rhythms and frantic blasts of horns with hardcore intensity.

children.name: Crack Rock Steady
children.description: Fuses Skacore with elements of Crust Punk and sometimes Metal; coupled with anti-establishment lyrics.
